testcase.name: Google Search for university webpage and check university logo is present
testcase.classname: Search for university webpage and check university logo is present

failure.message:
Timed out retrying after 4000ms: `cy.should()` failed because this element is detached from the DOM.
`<input class="gLFyf gsfi" jsaction="paste:puy29d;" maxlength="2048" name="q" type="text" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-haspopup="false" autocapitalize="off" autocomplete="off" autocorrect="off" autofocus="" role="combobox" spellcheck="false" title="Search" value="" aria-label="Search" data-ved="0ahUKEwjBsNj7tOf6AhXmg84BHXaSA7QQ39UDCAQ">`
Cypress requires elements be attached in the DOM to interact with them.
The previous command that ran was:
> `cy.get()`
This DOM element likely became detached somewhere between the previous and current command.
Common situations why this happens: - Your JS framework re-rendered asynchronously - Your app code reacted to an event firing and removed the element
You typically need to re-query for the element or add 'guards' which delay Cypress from running new commands.
https://on.cypress.io/element-has-detached-from-dom
